comments.body: This function appears to be the same in both clang.sh and clang++.sh.  Can you move it into a third file which you source from these two, to prevent code duplication?
If the anaconda recipe is fixed I'll change this in conda-forge, but till then, I'll keep this as it is so that it's easier for them to take our changes and for us to take their changes.
Is this coming from an anaconda recipe? It looked like you wrote it :wink: (Also, I am on vacations now, so don't let me block this.)
Yes, everything except the version bump came from the anaconda recipe. Anaconda recipe is for 4.0.1, this recipe copies it and bumps the version to 8.0.0

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +29,33 @@#  cases NAME simply gets reset to CONDA_BACKUP_NAME.  It is
#  a fatal error if a program is identified but not present.
function _tc_activation() {
  local act_nature=$1; shift
  local tc_nature=$1; shift
